title: Fujiwara Opera
text:
The is an <a href="opera">opera</a> company located in <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>, and is notably that nation's first and oldest professional opera company.
Historical overview.
It was founded in 1934 by operatic tenor <a href="Yoshie%20Fujiwara">Yoshie Fujiwara</a>. Following <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> the company entered a period of great success, beginning with a highly popular production of <a href="Giuseppe%20Verdi">Giuseppe Verdi</a>'s "<a href="La%20traviata">La traviata</a>" which was given more than 400 performances under the baton of <a href="Manfred%20Gurlitt">Manfred Gurlitt</a>. Renowned tenor <a href="Arrigo%20Pola">Arrigo Pola</a> was the company's Artistic Director between 1957 and 1965. After he left the company went into a period of decline, but eventually the company began to thrive again beginning in the late 1970s. Since 1980 the company has been managed by the <a href="Japan%20Opera%20Foundation">Japan Opera Foundation</a>, an organization which also manages the <a href="Nihon%20Opera%20Kyokai">Nihon Opera Kyokai</a>.
